alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Whitley County through 745 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Redbird, or near Williamsburg, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Williamsburg, Bon and Wofford around 710 PM EDT. Jellico Creek and Suttons Mill around 715 PM EDT. Emlyn, Yaden, Ayers, Lucky and Julip around 720 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pleasant View, Verne, Mountain Ash, Dixie, Nevisdale, Saxton, Red Ash, Packard, Polly Camp, Gatliff, Lot and Wilkerson. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
